scenes.name: The News of Mr. Bingley's Arrival
scenes.summary: The Bennet family learns of Mr. Bingley's arrival at Netherfield Park, sparking Mrs. Bennet's hopes of marrying off one of her daughters.
scenes.firstLine: 'My dear Mr. Bennet,' said his lady to him one day, 'have you heard that Netherfield Park is let at last?'
scenes.lastLine: 'You want to tell me, and I have no objection to hearing it.'

scenes.name: The Meryton Assembly
scenes.summary: The Bennet sisters attend a ball where Jane catches Mr. Bingley's eye, and Elizabeth first encounters the proud Mr. Darcy.
scenes.firstLine: The Meryton assembly was always productive of the most interesting intelligence.
scenes.lastLine: 'Which do you mean?' and turning round he looked for a moment at Elizabeth, till catching her eye, he withdrew his own and coldly said: 'She is tolerable, but not handsome enough to tempt me.'

scenes.name: Jane's Illness at Netherfield
scenes.summary: Jane is invited to Netherfield Park and falls ill, prompting Elizabeth to visit and stay with her.

scenes.name: Elizabeth's Stay at Netherfield
scenes.summary: Elizabeth tends to Jane at Netherfield, engaging in verbal sparring with Mr. Darcy and observing the behaviors of Mr. Bingley's sisters.
scenes.firstLine: 'Miss Eliza Bennet,' said Miss Bingley, 'despises cards. She is a great reader and has no pleasure in anything else.'

scenes.name: The Proposal at Hunsford Parsonage
scenes.summary: Mr. Collins proposes to Elizabeth at the Collinses' home, and she rejects him.
scenes.lastLine: '...and I am convinced that my chance of happiness with him is as fair as most people can boast on entering the marriage state.'

characters.name: Elizabeth Bennet

scenes.name: The Netherfield Ball
scenes.summary: At the Netherfield ball, Elizabeth's family behaves improperly, Mr. Darcy struggles with his feelings for Elizabeth, and Mr. Wickham's absence is noted.
scenes.firstLine: The Netherfield ball was, at last, to be a reality.
scenes.lastLine: 'Mr. Darcy, you must allow me to present this young lady to you as a very desirable partner.'

characters.name: Elizabeth Bennet
characters.quote: 'I am perfectly ready, I assure you, to keep my engagement; and when your sister is recovered, you shall, if you please, name the very day of the ball.'

characters.name: Mr. Darcy
characters.quote: 'In vain I have struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed. You must allow me to tell you how ardently I admire and love you.'

characters.name: Mrs. Bennet
characters.quote: 'Oh! my dear Mr. Bennet,' she cried, 'we have had a most delightful evening, a most excellent ball. I wish you had been there.'

scenes.name: Mr. Darcy's First Proposal
scenes.summary: Mr. Darcy awkwardly proposes to Elizabeth, who rejects him and confronts him about his actions towards Jane and Mr. Wickham.
scenes.firstLine: 'In vain I have struggled. It will not do. My feelings will not be repressed.'
scenes.lastLine: 'You have said quite enough, madam. I perfectly comprehend your feelings, and have now only to be ashamed of what my own have been.'

characters.name: Elizabeth Bennet
characters.quote: 'You are the last man in the world whom I could ever be prevailed on to marry.'

characters.name: Mr. Darcy
characters.quote: 'You have said quite enough, madam. I perfectly comprehend your feelings.'

scenes.name: Darcy's Letter
scenes.summary: After Elizabeth rejects his proposal, Mr. Darcy gives her a letter explaining his actions regarding Jane and Mr. Wickham, altering her perceptions.
scenes.firstLine: Elizabeth, with a slight bow, turned again into the plantation, and was soon out of sight.
scenes.lastLine: 'I have no reason, therefore, to be dissatisfied with my view of the present state of our affairs.'

characters.name: Elizabeth Bennet
characters.quote: 'She grew absolutely ashamed of herself. Of neither Darcy nor Wickham could she think, without feeling that she had been blind.'

characters.name: Mr. Darcy
characters.quote: 'I write without any intention of paining you, or humbling myself, by dwelling on wishes which, for the happiness of both, cannot be too soon forgotten.'

scenes.name: Lydia's Elopement
scenes.summary: The Bennet family is thrown into disarray when Lydia elopes with Mr. Wickham, jeopardizing the family's reputation.
scenes.firstLine: 'Lydia left a note for Colonel Forster, to be delivered to me in case of his absence,'
scenes.lastLine: 'We shall be off in half an hour.'

characters.name: Mr. Wickham

scenes.name: Mr. Darcy's Role Revealed
scenes.summary: Elizabeth learns that Mr. Darcy played a key role in resolving Lydia's situation, changing her feelings towards him.
scenes.firstLine: 'I have just received your letter, and shall devote this whole morning to answering it,'

characters.quote: 'Elizabeth was too much embarrassed to say a word.'

scenes.name: Elizabeth Visits Pemberley
scenes.summary: Elizabeth visits Pemberley with her aunt and uncle, admiring the estate and learning more about Mr. Darcy's true character from his servants.
scenes.firstLine: 'They gradually ascended for half a mile, and then found themselves at the top of a considerable eminence,'
scenes.lastLine: 'And at that moment, she felt that to be mistress of Pemberley might be something!'

characters.name: Elizabeth Bennet
characters.quote: 'And at that moment, she felt that to be mistress of Pemberley might be something!'

characters.name: Mr. Darcy
characters.quote: 'Elizabeth was delighted. He had never been so kind, so very kind, as he was on this occasion.'

scenes.name: Mr. Darcy's Second Proposal
scenes.summary: Mr. Darcy proposes to Elizabeth again, and this time, with mutual understanding and affection, she accepts.
scenes.firstLine: 'My affections and wishes are unchanged, but one word from you will silence me on this subject forever.'
scenes.lastLine: 'Elizabeth, feeling all the more than common awkwardness and anxiety of his situation, now forced herself to speak.'

characters.name: Elizabeth Bennet
characters.quote: 'My feelings are so different. In fact, they are quite the opposite.'

characters.name: Mr. Darcy
characters.quote: 'My affections and wishes are unchanged, but one word from you will silence me on this subject forever.'

scenes.name: Lady Catherine's Visit
scenes.summary: Lady Catherine confronts Elizabeth about rumors of her engagement to Mr. Darcy, demanding she renounce any such plans.
scenes.firstLine: 'Miss Bennet, I insist on being satisfied. Has he, has my nephew, made you an offer of marriage?'
scenes.lastLine: 'I am not to be intimidated into anything so wholly unreasonable.'

characters.name: Elizabeth Bennet
characters.quote: 'You have no right to demand such a thing.'

characters.name: Lady Catherine
characters.quote: 'Are the shades of Pemberley to be thus polluted?'

scenes.name: The Bennets Learn of Elizabeth's Engagement
scenes.summary: Elizabeth and Mr. Darcy announce their engagement to her family, who are surprised and delighted.
scenes.firstLine: 'My dear, dear Lizzy, I would - I do congratulate you - but are you certain? Forgive the question - are you quite certain that you can be happy with him?'
scenes.lastLine: 'And so, all was settled, and Elizabeth, with the lively, playful disposition which delighted in anything ridiculous, was ready to embrace her future with Mr. Darcy.'

characters.name: Elizabeth Bennet
characters.quote: 'I am, I am very sure that I will be very happy.'

characters.name: Mr. Darcy
characters.quote: 'I thank you, sir, for your warm acceptance of me.'

characters.name: Mr. Bennet
characters.quote: 'If this be the case, he deserves you. I could not have parted with you, my Lizzy, to anyone less worthy.'

scenes.name: Reflections and Plans for the Future
scenes.summary: Elizabeth and Mr. Darcy discuss their past misunderstandings and look forward to their future together.
